title: U.S. Stock Futures Pull Back After S&P 500 Record
sub_head: Major indexes poised for muted declines a day after the Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 closed at all-time highs
body:
U.S. stock futures edged lower Wednesday, suggesting that major indexes will take a breather after climbing to record highs.
Futures tied to the S&P 500 ticked down 0.3%, a day after the benchmark set its 27th closing record of the year. Contracts linked to the technology-heavy Nasdaq-100 index also slid 0.3%, while Dow Jones Industrial Average futures retreated 0.5%.
